82# elif defined (ANDROID_NDK)
83# include <android/log.h>
84# define TIXMLASSERT( x ) if ( !(x)) { __android_log_assert( "assert", "grinliz", "ASSERT in '%s' at %d.", __FILE__, __LINE__ ); }
85# else
86# include <assert.h>
87# define TIXMLASSERT assert
88# endif
89# else

94#if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1400 ) && (!defined WINCE)
95// Microsoft visual studio, version 2005 and higher.
96/*int _snprintf_s(
97 char *buffer,
98 size_t sizeOfBuffer,
99 size_t count,
100 const char *format [,
101 argument] ...
102);*/
103inline int TIXML_SNPRINTF( char* buffer, size_t size, const char* format, ... )
104{
105 va_list va;
106 va_start( va, format );
107 int result = vsnprintf_s( buffer, size, _TRUNCATE, format, va );
108 va_end( va );
109 return result;
110}
111#define TIXML_SSCANF sscanf_s
112#elif defined WINCE
113#define TIXML_SNPRINTF _snprintf
114#define TIXML_SSCANF sscanf
115#else
116// GCC version 3 and higher
117//#warning( "Using sn* functions." )
118#define TIXML_SNPRINTF snprintf
119#define TIXML_SSCANF sscanf
120#endif

127static const int TIXML2_PATCH_VERSION = 0;

140/*
141 A class that wraps strings. Normally stores the start and end
142 pointers into the XML file itself, and will apply normalization
143 and entity translation if actually read. Can also store (and memory
144 manage) a traditional char[]
145*/
146class StrPair
147{
148public:
149 enum {
150 NEEDS_ENTITY_PROCESSING = 0x01,
151 NEEDS_NEWLINE_NORMALIZATION = 0x02,
152 COLLAPSE_WHITESPACE = 0x04,
153
154 TEXT_ELEMENT = NEEDS_ENTITY_PROCESSING | NEEDS_NEWLINE_NORMALIZATION,
155 TEXT_ELEMENT_LEAVE_ENTITIES = NEEDS_NEWLINE_NORMALIZATION,
156 ATTRIBUTE_NAME = 0,
157 ATTRIBUTE_VALUE = NEEDS_ENTITY_PROCESSING | NEEDS_NEWLINE_NORMALIZATION,
158 ATTRIBUTE_VALUE_LEAVE_ENTITIES = NEEDS_NEWLINE_NORMALIZATION,
159 COMMENT = NEEDS_NEWLINE_NORMALIZATION
160 };
161
162 StrPair() : _flags( 0 ), _start( 0 ), _end( 0 ) {}
163 ~StrPair();
164
165 void Set( char* start, char* end, int flags ) {
166 Reset();
167 _start = start;
168 _end = end;
169 _flags = flags | NEEDS_FLUSH;
170 }
171
172 const char* GetStr();
173
174 bool Empty() const {
175 return _start == _end;
176 }
177
178 void SetInternedStr( const char* str ) {
179 Reset();
180 _start = const_cast<char*>(str);
181 }
182
183 void SetStr( const char* str, int flags=0 );
184
185 char* ParseText( char* in, const char* endTag, int strFlags );
186 char* ParseName( char* in );
187
188private:
189 void Reset();
190 void CollapseWhitespace();
191
192 enum {
193 NEEDS_FLUSH = 0x100,
194 NEEDS_DELETE = 0x200
195 };
196
197 // After parsing, if *_end != 0, it can be set to zero.
198 int _flags;
199 char* _start;
200 char* _end;
201};
202
203
204/*
205 A dynamic array of Plain Old Data. Doesn't support constructors, etc.
206 Has a small initial memory pool, so that low or no usage will not
207 cause a call to new/delete
208*/
209template <class T, int INIT>
210class DynArray
211{
212public:
213 DynArray< T, INIT >() {
214 _mem = _pool;
215 _allocated = INIT;
216 _size = 0;
217 }
218
219 ~DynArray() {
220 if ( _mem != _pool ) {
221 delete [] _mem;
222 }
223 }
224
225 void Clear() {
226 _size = 0;
227 }
228
229 void Push( T t ) {
230 EnsureCapacity( _size+1 );
231 _mem[_size++] = t;
232 }
233
234 T* PushArr( int count ) {
235 EnsureCapacity( _size+count );
236 T* ret = &_mem[_size];
237 _size += count;
238 return ret;
239 }
240
241 T Pop() {
242 return _mem[--_size];
243 }
244
245 void PopArr( int count ) {
246 TIXMLASSERT( _size >= count );
247 _size -= count;
248 }
249
250 bool Empty() const {
251 return _size == 0;
252 }
253
254 T& operator[](int i) {
255 TIXMLASSERT( i>= 0 && i < _size );
256 return _mem[i];
257 }
258
259 const T& operator[](int i) const {
260 TIXMLASSERT( i>= 0 && i < _size );
261 return _mem[i];
262 }
263
264 const T& PeekTop() const {
265 TIXMLASSERT( _size > 0 );
266 return _mem[ _size - 1];
267 }
268
269 int Size() const {
270 return _size;
271 }
272
273 int Capacity() const {
274 return _allocated;
275 }
276
277 const T* Mem() const {
278 return _mem;
279 }
280
281 T* Mem() {
282 return _mem;
283 }
284
285private:
286 void EnsureCapacity( int cap ) {
287 if ( cap > _allocated ) {
288 int newAllocated = cap * 2;
289 T* newMem = new T[newAllocated];
290 memcpy( newMem, _mem, sizeof(T)*_size ); // warning: not using constructors, only works for PODs
291 if ( _mem != _pool ) {
292 delete [] _mem;
293 }
294 _mem = newMem;
295 _allocated = newAllocated;
296 }
297 }
298
299 T* _mem;
300 T _pool[INIT];
301 int _allocated; // objects allocated
302 int _size; // number objects in use
303};
304
305
306/*
307 Parent virtual class of a pool for fast allocation
308 and deallocation of objects.
309*/
310class MemPool
311{
312public:
313 MemPool() {}
314 virtual ~MemPool() {}
315
316 virtual int ItemSize() const = 0;
317 virtual void* Alloc() = 0;
318 virtual void Free( void* ) = 0;
319 virtual void SetTracked() = 0;
320};
321
322
323/*
324 Template child class to create pools of the correct type.
325*/
326template< int SIZE >
327class MemPoolT : public MemPool
328{
329public:
330 MemPoolT() : _root(0), _currentAllocs(0), _nAllocs(0), _maxAllocs(0), _nUntracked(0) {}
331 ~MemPoolT() {
332 // Delete the blocks.
333 for( int i=0; i<_blockPtrs.Size(); ++i ) {
334 delete _blockPtrs[i];
335 }
336 }
337
338 virtual int ItemSize() const {
339 return SIZE;
340 }
341 int CurrentAllocs() const {
342 return _currentAllocs;
343 }
344
345 virtual void* Alloc() {
346 if ( !_root ) {
347 // Need a new block.
348 Block* block = new Block();
349 _blockPtrs.Push( block );
350
351 for( int i=0; i<COUNT-1; ++i ) {
352 block->chunk[i].next = &block->chunk[i+1];
353 }
354 block->chunk[COUNT-1].next = 0;
355 _root = block->chunk;
356 }
357 void* result = _root;
358 _root = _root->next;
359
360 ++_currentAllocs;
361 if ( _currentAllocs > _maxAllocs ) {
362 _maxAllocs = _currentAllocs;
363 }
364 _nAllocs++;
365 _nUntracked++;
366 return result;
367 }
368 virtual void Free( void* mem ) {
369 if ( !mem ) {
370 return;
371 }
372 --_currentAllocs;
373 Chunk* chunk = static_cast<Chunk*>( mem );
374#ifdef DEBUG
375 memset( chunk, 0xfe, sizeof(Chunk) );
376#endif
377 chunk->next = _root;
378 _root = chunk;
379 }
380 void Trace( const char* name ) {
381 printf( "Mempool %s watermark=%d [%dk] current=%d size=%d nAlloc=%d blocks=%d\n",
382 name, _maxAllocs, _maxAllocs*SIZE/1024, _currentAllocs, SIZE, _nAllocs, _blockPtrs.Size() );
383 }
384
385 void SetTracked() {
386 _nUntracked--;
387 }
388
389 int Untracked() const {
390 return _nUntracked;
391 }
392
393 // This number is perf sensitive. 4k seems like a good tradeoff on my machine.
394 // The test file is large, 170k.
395 // Release: VS2010 gcc(no opt)
396 // 1k: 4000
397 // 2k: 4000
398 // 4k: 3900 21000
399 // 16k: 5200
400 // 32k: 4300
401 // 64k: 4000 21000
402 enum { COUNT = (4*1024)/SIZE }; // Some compilers do not accept to use COUNT in private part if COUNT is private
403
404private:
405 union Chunk {
406 Chunk* next;
407 char mem[SIZE];
408 };
409 struct Block {
410 Chunk chunk[COUNT];
411 };
412 DynArray< Block*, 10 > _blockPtrs;
413 Chunk* _root;
414
415 int _currentAllocs;
416 int _nAllocs;
417 int _maxAllocs;
418 int _nUntracked;
419};
420
421
422
423/**
424 Implements the interface to the "Visitor pattern" (see the Accept() method.)
425 If you call the Accept() method, it requires being passed a XMLVisitor
426 class to handle callbacks. For nodes that contain other nodes (Document, Element)
427 you will get called with a VisitEnter/VisitExit pair. Nodes that are always leafs
428 are simply called with Visit().
429
430 If you return 'true' from a Visit method, recursive parsing will continue. If you return
431 false, <b>no children of this node or its siblings</b> will be visited.
432
433 All flavors of Visit methods have a default implementation that returns 'true' (continue
434 visiting). You need to only override methods that are interesting to you.
435
436 Generally Accept() is called on the XMLDocument, although all nodes support visiting.
437
438 You should never change the document from a callback.
439
440 @sa XMLNode::Accept()
441*/
442class TINYXML2_LIB XMLVisitor
443{
444public:
445 virtual ~XMLVisitor() {}
446
447 /// Visit a document.
448 virtual bool VisitEnter( const XMLDocument& /*doc*/ ) {
449 return true;
450 }
451 /// Visit a document.
452 virtual bool VisitExit( const XMLDocument& /*doc*/ ) {
453 return true;
454 }
455
456 /// Visit an element.
457 virtual bool VisitEnter( const XMLElement& /*element*/, const XMLAttribute* /*firstAttribute*/ ) {
458 return true;
459 }
460 /// Visit an element.
461 virtual bool VisitExit( const XMLElement& /*element*/ ) {
462 return true;
463 }
464
465 /// Visit a declaration.
466 virtual bool Visit( const XMLDeclaration& /*declaration*/ ) {
467 return true;
468 }
469 /// Visit a text node.
470 virtual bool Visit( const XMLText& /*text*/ ) {
471 return true;
472 }
473 /// Visit a comment node.
474 virtual bool Visit( const XMLComment& /*comment*/ ) {
475 return true;
476 }
477 /// Visit an unknown node.
478 virtual bool Visit( const XMLUnknown& /*unknown*/ ) {
479 return true;
480 }
481};
482
483
484/*
485 Utility functionality.
486*/
487class XMLUtil
488{
489public:
490 // Anything in the high order range of UTF-8 is assumed to not be whitespace. This isn't
491 // correct, but simple, and usually works.
492 static const char* SkipWhiteSpace( const char* p ) {
493 while( !IsUTF8Continuation(*p) && isspace( *reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char*>(p) ) ) {
494 ++p;
495 }
496 return p;
497 }
498 static char* SkipWhiteSpace( char* p ) {
499 while( !IsUTF8Continuation(*p) && isspace( *reinterpret_cast<unsigned char*>(p) ) ) {
500 ++p;
501 }
502 return p;
503 }
504 static bool IsWhiteSpace( char p ) {
505 return !IsUTF8Continuation(p) && isspace( static_cast<unsigned char>(p) );
506 }
507
508 inline static bool IsNameStartChar( unsigned char ch ) {
509 return ( ( ch < 128 ) ? isalpha( ch ) : 1 )
510 || ch == ':'
511 || ch == '_';
512 }
513
514 inline static bool IsNameChar( unsigned char ch ) {
515 return IsNameStartChar( ch )
516 || isdigit( ch )
517 || ch == '.'
518 || ch == '-';
519 }
520
521 inline static bool StringEqual( const char* p, const char* q, int nChar=INT_MAX ) {
522 int n = 0;
523 if ( p == q ) {
524 return true;
525 }
526 while( *p && *q && *p == *q && n<nChar ) {
527 ++p;
528 ++q;
529 ++n;
530 }
531 if ( (n == nChar) || ( *p == 0 && *q == 0 ) ) {
532 return true;
533 }
534 return false;
535 }
536
537 inline static int IsUTF8Continuation( const char p ) {
538 return p & 0x80;
539 }
540
541 static const char* ReadBOM( const char* p, bool* hasBOM );
542 // p is the starting location,
543 // the UTF-8 value of the entity will be placed in value, and length filled in.
544 static const char* GetCharacterRef( const char* p, char* value, int* length );
545 static void ConvertUTF32ToUTF8( unsigned long input, char* output, int* length );
546
547 // converts primitive types to strings
548 static void ToStr( int v, char* buffer, int bufferSize );
549 static void ToStr( unsigned v, char* buffer, int bufferSize );
550 static void ToStr( bool v, char* buffer, int bufferSize );
551 static void ToStr( float v, char* buffer, int bufferSize );
552 static void ToStr( double v, char* buffer, int bufferSize );
553
554 // converts strings to primitive types
555 static bool ToInt( const char* str, int* value );
556 static bool ToUnsigned( const char* str, unsigned* value );
557 static bool ToBool( const char* str, bool* value );
558 static bool ToFloat( const char* str, float* value );
559 static bool ToDouble( const char* str, double* value );
560};
561
562
563/** XMLNode is a base class for every object that is in the
564 XML Document Object Model (DOM), except XMLAttributes.
565 Nodes have siblings, a parent, and children which can
566 be navigated. A node is always in a XMLDocument.
567 The type of a XMLNode can be queried, and it can
568 be cast to its more defined type.
569
570 A XMLDocument allocates memory for all its Nodes.
571 When the XMLDocument gets deleted, all its Nodes
572 will also be deleted.
573
574 @verbatim
575 A Document can contain: Element (container or leaf)
576 Comment (leaf)
577 Unknown (leaf)
578 Declaration( leaf )
579
580 An Element can contain: Element (container or leaf)
581 Text (leaf)
582 Attributes (not on tree)
583 Comment (leaf)
584 Unknown (leaf)
585
586 @endverbatim
587*/
588class TINYXML2_LIB XMLNode
589{
590 friend class XMLDocument;
591 friend class XMLElement;
592public:
593
594 /// Get the XMLDocument that owns this XMLNode.
595 const XMLDocument* GetDocument() const {
596 return _document;
597 }
598 /// Get the XMLDocument that owns this XMLNode.
599 XMLDocument* GetDocument() {
600 return _document;
601 }
602
603 /// Safely cast to an Element, or null.
604 virtual XMLElement* ToElement() {
605 return 0;
606 }
607 /// Safely cast to Text, or null.
608 virtual XMLText* ToText() {
609 return 0;
610 }
611 /// Safely cast to a Comment, or null.
612 virtual XMLComment* ToComment() {
613 return 0;
614 }
615 /// Safely cast to a Document, or null.
616 virtual XMLDocument* ToDocument() {
617 return 0;
618 }
619 /// Safely cast to a Declaration, or null.
620 virtual XMLDeclaration* ToDeclaration() {
621 return 0;
622 }
623 /// Safely cast to an Unknown, or null.
624 virtual XMLUnknown* ToUnknown() {
625 return 0;
626 }
627
628 virtual const XMLElement* ToElement() const {
629 return 0;
630 }
631 virtual const XMLText* ToText() const {
632 return 0;
633 }
634 virtual const XMLComment* ToComment() const {
635 return 0;
636 }
637 virtual const XMLDocument* ToDocument() const {
638 return 0;
639 }
640 virtual const XMLDeclaration* ToDeclaration() const {
641 return 0;
642 }
643 virtual const XMLUnknown* ToUnknown() const {
644 return 0;
645 }
646
647 /** The meaning of 'value' changes for the specific type.
648 @verbatim
649 Document: empty
650 Element: name of the element
651 Comment: the comment text
652 Unknown: the tag contents
653 Text: the text string
654 @endverbatim
655 */
656 const char* Value() const;
657
658 /** Set the Value of an XML node.
659 @sa Value()
660 */
661 void SetValue( const char* val, bool staticMem=false );
662
663 /// Get the parent of this node on the DOM.
664 const XMLNode* Parent() const {
665 return _parent;
666 }
667
668 XMLNode* Parent() {
669 return _parent;
670 }
671
672 /// Returns true if this node has no children.
673 bool NoChildren() const {
674 return !_firstChild;
675 }
676
677 /// Get the first child node, or null if none exists.
678 const XMLNode* FirstChild() const {
679 return _firstChild;
680 }
681
682 XMLNode* FirstChild() {
683 return _firstChild;
684 }
685
686 /** Get the first child element, or optionally the first child
687 element with the specified name.
688 */
689 const XMLElement* FirstChildElement( const char* value=0 ) const;
690
691 XMLElement* FirstChildElement( const char* value=0 ) {
692 return const_cast<XMLElement*>(const_cast<const XMLNode*>(this)->FirstChildElement( value ));
693 }
694
695 /// Get the last child node, or null if none exists.
696 const XMLNode* LastChild() const {
697 return _lastChild;
698 }
699
700 XMLNode* LastChild() {
701 return const_cast<XMLNode*>(const_cast<const XMLNode*>(this)->LastChild() );
702 }
703
704 /** Get the last child element or optionally the last child
705 element with the specified name.
706 */
707 const XMLElement* LastChildElement( const char* value=0 ) const;
708
709 XMLElement* LastChildElement( const char* value=0 ) {
710 return const_cast<XMLElement*>(const_cast<const XMLNode*>(this)->LastChildElement(value) );
711 }
712
713 /// Get the previous (left) sibling node of this node.
714 const XMLNode* PreviousSibling() const {
715 return _prev;
716 }
717
718 XMLNode* PreviousSibling() {
719 return _prev;
720 }
721
722 /// Get the previous (left) sibling element of this node, with an optionally supplied name.
723 const XMLElement* PreviousSiblingElement( const char* value=0 ) const ;
724
725 XMLElement* PreviousSiblingElement( const char* value=0 ) {
726 return const_cast<XMLElement*>(const_cast<const XMLNode*>(this)->PreviousSiblingElement( value ) );
727 }
728
729 /// Get the next (right) sibling node of this node.
730 const XMLNode* NextSibling() const {
731 return _next;
732 }
733
734 XMLNode* NextSibling() {
735 return _next;
736 }
737
738 /// Get the next (right) sibling element of this node, with an optionally supplied name.
739 const XMLElement* NextSiblingElement( const char* value=0 ) const;
740
741 XMLElement* NextSiblingElement( const char* value=0 ) {
742 return const_cast<XMLElement*>(const_cast<const XMLNode*>(this)->NextSiblingElement( value ) );
743 }
744
745 /**
746 Add a child node as the last (right) child.
747 If the child node is already part of the document,
748 it is moved from its old location to the new location.
749 Returns the addThis argument or 0 if the node does not
750 belong to the same document.
751 */
752 XMLNode* InsertEndChild( XMLNode* addThis );
753
754 XMLNode* LinkEndChild( XMLNode* addThis ) {
755 return InsertEndChild( addThis );
756 }
757 /**
758 Add a child node as the first (left) child.
759 If the child node is already part of the document,
760 it is moved from its old location to the new location.
761 Returns the addThis argument or 0 if the node does not
762 belong to the same document.
763 */
764 XMLNode* InsertFirstChild( XMLNode* addThis );
765 /**
766 Add a node after the specified child node.
767 If the child node is already part of the document,
768 it is moved from its old location to the new location.
769 Returns the addThis argument or 0 if the afterThis node
770 is not a child of this node, or if the node does not
771 belong to the same document.
772 */
773 XMLNode* InsertAfterChild( XMLNode* afterThis, XMLNode* addThis );
774
775 /**
776 Delete all the children of this node.
777 */
778 void DeleteChildren();
779
780 /**
781 Delete a child of this node.
782 */
783 void DeleteChild( XMLNode* node );
784
785 /**
786 Make a copy of this node, but not its children.
787 You may pass in a Document pointer that will be
788 the owner of the new Node. If the 'document' is
789 null, then the node returned will be allocated
790 from the current Document. (this->GetDocument())
791
792 Note: if called on a XMLDocument, this will return null.
793 */
794 virtual XMLNode* ShallowClone( XMLDocument* document ) const = 0;
795
796 /**
797 Test if 2 nodes are the same, but don't test children.
798 The 2 nodes do not need to be in the same Document.
799
800 Note: if called on a XMLDocument, this will return false.
801 */
802 virtual bool ShallowEqual( const XMLNode* compare ) const = 0;
803
804 /** Accept a hierarchical visit of the nodes in the TinyXML-2 DOM. Every node in the
805 XML tree will be conditionally visited and the host will be called back
806 via the XMLVisitor interface.
807
808 This is essentially a SAX interface for TinyXML-2. (Note however it doesn't re-parse
809 the XML for the callbacks, so the performance of TinyXML-2 is unchanged by using this
810 interface versus any other.)
811
812 The interface has been based on ideas from:
813
814 - http://www.saxproject.org/
815 - http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?HierarchicalVisitorPattern
816
817 Which are both good references for "visiting".
818
819 An example of using Accept():
820 @verbatim
821 XMLPrinter printer;
822 tinyxmlDoc.Accept( &printer );
823 const char* xmlcstr = printer.CStr();
824 @endverbatim
825 */
826 virtual bool Accept( XMLVisitor* visitor ) const = 0;
827
828 // internal
829 virtual char* ParseDeep( char*, StrPair* );
830
831protected:
832 XMLNode( XMLDocument* );
833 virtual ~XMLNode();
834 XMLNode( const XMLNode& ); // not supported
835 XMLNode& operator=( const XMLNode& ); // not supported
836
837 XMLDocument* _document;
838 XMLNode* _parent;
839 mutable StrPair _value;
840
841 XMLNode* _firstChild;
842 XMLNode* _lastChild;
843
844 XMLNode* _prev;
845 XMLNode* _next;
846
847private:
848 MemPool* _memPool;
849 void Unlink( XMLNode* child );
850};
851
852
853/** XML text.
854
855 Note that a text node can have child element nodes, for example:
856 @verbatim
857 <root>This is <b>bold</b></root>
858 @endverbatim
859
860 A text node can have 2 ways to output the next. "normal" output
861 and CDATA. It will default to the mode it was parsed from the XML file and
862 you generally want to leave it alone, but you can change the output mode with
863 SetCData() and query it with CData().
864*/
865class TINYXML2_LIB XMLText : public XMLNode
866{
867 friend class XMLBase;
868 friend class XMLDocument;
869public:
870 virtual bool Accept( XMLVisitor* visitor ) const;
871
872 virtual XMLText* ToText() {
873 return this;
874 }
875 virtual const XMLText* ToText() const {
876 return this;
877 }
878
879 /// Declare whether this should be CDATA or standard text.
880 void SetCData( bool isCData ) {
881 _isCData = isCData;
882 }
883 /// Returns true if this is a CDATA text element.
884 bool CData() const {
885 return _isCData;
886 }
887
888 char* ParseDeep( char*, StrPair* endTag );
889 virtual XMLNode* ShallowClone( XMLDocument* document ) const;
890 virtual bool ShallowEqual( const XMLNode* compare ) const;
891
892protected:
893 XMLText( XMLDocument* doc ) : XMLNode( doc ), _isCData( false ) {}
894 virtual ~XMLText() {}
895 XMLText( const XMLText& ); // not supported
896 XMLText& operator=( const XMLText& ); // not supported
897
898private:
899 bool _isCData;
900};
901
902
903/** An XML Comment. */
904class TINYXML2_LIB XMLComment : public XMLNode
905{
906 friend class XMLDocument;
907public:
908 virtual XMLComment* ToComment() {
909 return this;
910 }
911 virtual const XMLComment* ToComment() const {
912 return this;
913 }
914
915 virtual bool Accept( XMLVisitor* visitor ) const;
916
917 char* ParseDeep( char*, StrPair* endTag );
918 virtual XMLNode* ShallowClone( XMLDocument* document ) const;
919 virtual bool ShallowEqual( const XMLNode* compare ) const;
920
921protected:
922 XMLComment( XMLDocument* doc );
923 virtual ~XMLComment();
924 XMLComment( const XMLComment& ); // not supported
925 XMLComment& operator=( const XMLComment& ); // not supported
926
927private:
928};

931/** In correct XML the declaration is the first entry in the file.
932 @verbatim
933 <?xml version="1.0" standalone="yes"?>
934 @endverbatim
935
936 TinyXML-2 will happily read or write files without a declaration,
937 however.
938
939 The text of the declaration isn't interpreted. It is parsed
940 and written as a string.
941*/
942class TINYXML2_LIB XMLDeclaration : public XMLNode

950 return this;

954
955 char* ParseDeep( char*, StrPair* endTag );

957 virtual bool ShallowEqual( const XMLNode* compare ) const;
958
959protected:
960 XMLDeclaration( XMLDocument* doc );

962 XMLDeclaration( const XMLDeclaration& ); // not supported
963 XMLDeclaration& operator=( const XMLDeclaration& ); // not supported
964};

967/** Any tag that TinyXML-2 doesn't recognize is saved as an

974class TINYXML2_LIB XMLUnknown : public XMLNode

979 return this;

982 return this;

989 virtual bool ShallowEqual( const XMLNode* compare ) const;

998
999enum XMLError {
1000 XML_NO_ERROR = 0,
1001 XML_SUCCESS = 0,
1002
1003 XML_NO_ATTRIBUTE,
1004 XML_WRONG_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE,
1005
1006 XML_ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND,
1007 XML_ERROR_FILE_COULD_NOT_BE_OPENED,
1008 XML_ERROR_FILE_READ_ERROR,
1009 XML_ERROR_ELEMENT_MISMATCH,
1010 XML_ERROR_PARSING_ELEMENT,
1011 XML_ERROR_PARSING_ATTRIBUTE,
1012 XML_ERROR_IDENTIFYING_TAG,
1013 XML_ERROR_PARSING_TEXT,
1014 XML_ERROR_PARSING_CDATA,
1015 XML_ERROR_PARSING_COMMENT,
1016 XML_ERROR_PARSING_DECLARATION,
1017 XML_ERROR_PARSING_UNKNOWN,
1018 XML_ERROR_EMPTY_DOCUMENT,
1019 XML_ERROR_MISMATCHED_ELEMENT,
1020 XML_ERROR_PARSING,
1021
1022 XML_CAN_NOT_CONVERT_TEXT,
1023 XML_NO_TEXT_NODE
1024};

1026
1027/** An attribute is a name-value pair. Elements have an arbitrary
1028 number of attributes, each with a unique name.
1029
1030 @note The attributes are not XMLNodes. You may only query the
1031 Next() attribute in a list.
1032*/
1033class TINYXML2_LIB XMLAttribute
1034{
1035 friend class XMLElement;
1036public:
1037 /// The name of the attribute.
1038 const char* Name() const;
1039
1040 /// The value of the attribute.
1041 const char* Value() const;
1042
1043 /// The next attribute in the list.
1044 const XMLAttribute* Next() const {
1045 return _next;
1046 }
1047
1048 /** IntValue interprets the attribute as an integer, and returns the value.
1049 If the value isn't an integer, 0 will be returned. There is no error checking;
1050 use QueryIntValue() if you need error checking.
1051 */
1052 int IntValue() const {
1053 int i=0;
1054 QueryIntValue( &i );
1055 return i;
1056 }
1057 /// Query as an unsigned integer. See IntValue()
1058 unsigned UnsignedValue() const {
1059 unsigned i=0;
1060 QueryUnsignedValue( &i );
1061 return i;
1062 }
1063 /// Query as a boolean. See IntValue()
1064 bool BoolValue() const {
1065 bool b=false;
1066 QueryBoolValue( &b );
1067 return b;
1068 }
1069 /// Query as a double. See IntValue()
1070 double DoubleValue() const {
1071 double d=0;
1072 QueryDoubleValue( &d );
1073 return d;
1074 }
1075 /// Query as a float. See IntValue()
1076 float FloatValue() const {
1077 float f=0;
1078 QueryFloatValue( &f );
1079 return f;
1080 }
1081
1082 /** QueryIntValue interprets the attribute as an integer, and returns the value
1083 in the provided parameter. The function will return XML_NO_ERROR on success,
1084 and XML_WRONG_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE if the conversion is not successful.
1085 */
1086 XMLError QueryIntValue( int* value ) const;
1087 /// See QueryIntValue
1088 XMLError QueryUnsignedValue( unsigned int* value ) const;
1089 /// See QueryIntValue
1090 XMLError QueryBoolValue( bool* value ) const;
1091 /// See QueryIntValue
1092 XMLError QueryDoubleValue( double* value ) const;
1093 /// See QueryIntValue
1094 XMLError QueryFloatValue( float* value ) const;
1095
1096 /// Set the attribute to a string value.
1097 void SetAttribute( const char* value );
1098 /// Set the attribute to value.
1099 void SetAttribute( int value );
1100 /// Set the attribute to value.
1101 void SetAttribute( unsigned value );
1102 /// Set the attribute to value.
1103 void SetAttribute( bool value );
1104 /// Set the attribute to value.
1105 void SetAttribute( double value );
1106 /// Set the attribute to value.
1107 void SetAttribute( float value );
1108
1109private:
1110 enum { BUF_SIZE = 200 };
1111
1112 XMLAttribute() : _next( 0 ), _memPool( 0 ) {}
1113 virtual ~XMLAttribute() {}
1114
1115 XMLAttribute( const XMLAttribute& ); // not supported
1116 void operator=( const XMLAttribute& ); // not supported
1117 void SetName( const char* name );
1118
1119 char* ParseDeep( char* p, bool processEntities );
1120
1121 mutable StrPair _name;
1122 mutable StrPair _value;
1123 XMLAttribute* _next;
1124 MemPool* _memPool;
1125};
1126
1127
1128/** The element is a container class. It has a value, the element name,
1129 and can contain other elements, text, comments, and unknowns.
1130 Elements also contain an arbitrary number of attributes.
1131*/
1132class TINYXML2_LIB XMLElement : public XMLNode
1133{
1134 friend class XMLBase;
1135 friend class XMLDocument;
1136public:
1137 /// Get the name of an element (which is the Value() of the node.)
1138 const char* Name() const {
1139 return Value();
1140 }
1141 /// Set the name of the element.
1142 void SetName( const char* str, bool staticMem=false ) {
1143 SetValue( str, staticMem );
1144 }
1145
1146 virtual XMLElement* ToElement() {
1147 return this;
1148 }
1149 virtual const XMLElement* ToElement() const {
1150 return this;
1151 }
1152 virtual bool Accept( XMLVisitor* visitor ) const;
1153
1154 /** Given an attribute name, Attribute() returns the value
1155 for the attribute of that name, or null if none
1156 exists. For example:
1157
1158 @verbatim
1159 const char* value = ele->Attribute( "foo" );
1160 @endverbatim
1161
1162 The 'value' parameter is normally null. However, if specified,
1163 the attribute will only be returned if the 'name' and 'value'
1164 match. This allow you to write code:
1165
1166 @verbatim
1167 if ( ele->Attribute( "foo", "bar" ) ) callFooIsBar();
1168 @endverbatim
1169
1170 rather than:
1171 @verbatim
1172 if ( ele->Attribute( "foo" ) ) {
1173 if ( strcmp( ele->Attribute( "foo" ), "bar" ) == 0 ) callFooIsBar();
1174 }
1175 @endverbatim
1176 */
1177 const char* Attribute( const char* name, const char* value=0 ) const;
1178
1179 /** Given an attribute name, IntAttribute() returns the value
1180 of the attribute interpreted as an integer. 0 will be
1181 returned if there is an error. For a method with error
1182 checking, see QueryIntAttribute()
1183 */
1184 int IntAttribute( const char* name ) const {
1185 int i=0;
1186 QueryIntAttribute( name, &i );
1187 return i;
1188 }
1189 /// See IntAttribute()
1190 unsigned UnsignedAttribute( const char* name ) const {
1191 unsigned i=0;
1192 QueryUnsignedAttribute( name, &i );
1193 return i;
1194 }
1195 /// See IntAttribute()
1196 bool BoolAttribute( const char* name ) const {
1197 bool b=false;
1198 QueryBoolAttribute( name, &b );
1199 return b;
1200 }
1201 /// See IntAttribute()
1202 double DoubleAttribute( const char* name ) const {
1203 double d=0;
1204 QueryDoubleAttribute( name, &d );
1205 return d;
1206 }
1207 /// See IntAttribute()
1208 float FloatAttribute( const char* name ) const {
1209 float f=0;
1210 QueryFloatAttribute( name, &f );
1211 return f;
1212 }
1213
1214 /** Given an attribute name, QueryIntAttribute() returns
1215 XML_NO_ERROR, XML_WRONG_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE if the conversion
1216 can't be performed, or XML_NO_ATTRIBUTE if the attribute
1217 doesn't exist. If successful, the result of the conversion
1218 will be written to 'value'. If not successful, nothing will
1219 be written to 'value'. This allows you to provide default
1220 value:
1221
1222 @verbatim
1223 int value = 10;
1224 QueryIntAttribute( "foo", &value ); // if "foo" isn't found, value will still be 10
1225 @endverbatim
1226 */
1227 XMLError QueryIntAttribute( const char* name, int* value ) const {
1228 const XMLAttribute* a = FindAttribute( name );
1229 if ( !a ) {
1230 return XML_NO_ATTRIBUTE;
1231 }
1232 return a->QueryIntValue( value );
1233 }
1234 /// See QueryIntAttribute()
1235 XMLError QueryUnsignedAttribute( const char* name, unsigned int* value ) const {
1236 const XMLAttribute* a = FindAttribute( name );
1237 if ( !a ) {
1238 return XML_NO_ATTRIBUTE;
1239 }
1240 return a->QueryUnsignedValue( value );
1241 }
1242 /// See QueryIntAttribute()
1243 XMLError QueryBoolAttribute( const char* name, bool* value ) const {
1244 const XMLAttribute* a = FindAttribute( name );
1245 if ( !a ) {
1246 return XML_NO_ATTRIBUTE;
1247 }
1248 return a->QueryBoolValue( value );
1249 }
1250 /// See QueryIntAttribute()
1251 XMLError QueryDoubleAttribute( const char* name, double* value ) const {
1252 const XMLAttribute* a = FindAttribute( name );
1253 if ( !a ) {
1254 return XML_NO_ATTRIBUTE;
1255 }
1256 return a->QueryDoubleValue( value );
1257 }
1258 /// See QueryIntAttribute()
1259 XMLError QueryFloatAttribute( const char* name, float* value ) const {
1260 const XMLAttribute* a = FindAttribute( name );
1261 if ( !a ) {
1262 return XML_NO_ATTRIBUTE;
1263 }
1264 return a->QueryFloatValue( value );
1265 }
1266
1267
1268 /** Given an attribute name, QueryAttribute() returns
1269 XML_NO_ERROR, XML_WRONG_ATTRIBUTE_TYPE if the conversion
1270 can't be performed, or XML_NO_ATTRIBUTE if the attribute
1271 doesn't exist. It is overloaded for the primitive types,
1272 and is a generally more convenient replacement of
1273 QueryIntAttribute() and related functions.
1274
1275 If successful, the result of the conversion
1276 will be written to 'value'. If not successful, nothing will
1277 be written to 'value'. This allows you to provide default
1278 value:
1279
1280 @verbatim
1281 int value = 10;
1282 QueryAttribute( "foo", &value ); // if "foo" isn't found, value will still be 10
1283 @endverbatim
1284 */
1285 int QueryAttribute( const char* name, int* value ) const {
1286 return QueryIntAttribute( name, value );
1287 }
1288
1289 int QueryAttribute( const char* name, unsigned int* value ) const {
1290 return QueryUnsignedAttribute( name, value );
1291 }
1292
1293 int QueryAttribute( const char* name, bool* value ) const {
1294 return QueryBoolAttribute( name, value );
1295 }
1296
1297 int QueryAttribute( const char* name, double* value ) const {
1298 return QueryDoubleAttribute( name, value );
1299 }
1300
1301 int QueryAttribute( const char* name, float* value ) const {
1302 return QueryFloatAttribute( name, value );
1303 }
1304
1305 /// Sets the named attribute to value.
1306 void SetAttribute( const char* name, const char* value ) {
1307 XMLAttribute* a = FindOrCreateAttribute( name );
1308 a->SetAttribute( value );
1309 }
1310 /// Sets the named attribute to value.
1311 void SetAttribute( const char* name, int value ) {
1312 XMLAttribute* a = FindOrCreateAttribute( name );
1313 a->SetAttribute( value );
1314 }
1315 /// Sets the named attribute to value.
1316 void SetAttribute( const char* name, unsigned value ) {
1317 XMLAttribute* a = FindOrCreateAttribute( name );
1318 a->SetAttribute( value );
1319 }
1320 /// Sets the named attribute to value.
1321 void SetAttribute( const char* name, bool value ) {
1322 XMLAttribute* a = FindOrCreateAttribute( name );
1323 a->SetAttribute( value );
1324 }
1325 /// Sets the named attribute to value.
1326 void SetAttribute( const char* name, double value ) {
1327 XMLAttribute* a = FindOrCreateAttribute( name );
1328 a->SetAttribute( value );
1329 }
1330 /// Sets the named attribute to value.
1331 void SetAttribute( const char* name, float value ) {
1332 XMLAttribute* a = FindOrCreateAttribute( name );
1333 a->SetAttribute( value );
1334 }
1335
1336 /**
1337 Delete an attribute.
1338 */
1339 void DeleteAttribute( const char* name );
1340
1341 /// Return the first attribute in the list.
1342 const XMLAttribute* FirstAttribute() const {
1343 return _rootAttribute;
1344 }
1345 /// Query a specific attribute in the list.
1346 const XMLAttribute* FindAttribute( const char* name ) const;
1347
1348 /** Convenience function for easy access to the text inside an element. Although easy
1349 and concise, GetText() is limited compared to getting the XMLText child
1350 and accessing it directly.
1351
1352 If the first child of 'this' is a XMLText, the GetText()
1353 returns the character string of the Text node, else null is returned.
1354
1355 This is a convenient method for getting the text of simple contained text:
1356 @verbatim
1357 <foo>This is text</foo>
1358 const char* str = fooElement->GetText();
1359 @endverbatim
1360
1361 'str' will be a pointer to "This is text".
1362
1363 Note that this function can be misleading. If the element foo was created from
1364 this XML:
1365 @verbatim
1366 <foo><b>This is text</b></foo>
1367 @endverbatim
1368
1369 then the value of str would be null. The first child node isn't a text node, it is
1370 another element. From this XML:
1371 @verbatim
1372 <foo>This is <b>text</b></foo>
1373 @endverbatim
1374 GetText() will return "This is ".
1375 */
1376 const char* GetText() const;
1377
1378 /** Convenience function for easy access to the text inside an element. Although easy
1379 and concise, SetText() is limited compared to creating an XMLText child
1380 and mutating it directly.
1381
1382 If the first child of 'this' is a XMLText, SetText() sets its value to
1383 the given string, otherwise it will create a first child that is an XMLText.
1384
1385 This is a convenient method for setting the text of simple contained text:
1386 @verbatim
1387 <foo>This is text</foo>
1388 fooElement->SetText( "Hullaballoo!" );
1389 <foo>Hullaballoo!</foo>
1390 @endverbatim
1391
1392 Note that this function can be misleading. If the element foo was created from
1393 this XML:
1394 @verbatim
1395 <foo><b>This is text</b></foo>
1396 @endverbatim
1397
1398 then it will not change "This is text", but rather prefix it with a text element:
1399 @verbatim
1400 <foo>Hullaballoo!<b>This is text</b></foo>
1401 @endverbatim
1402
1403 For this XML:
1404 @verbatim
1405 <foo />
1406 @endverbatim
1407 SetText() will generate
1408 @verbatim
1409 <foo>Hullaballoo!</foo>
1410 @endverbatim
1411 */
1412 void SetText( const char* inText );
1413 /// Convenience method for setting text inside and element. See SetText() for important limitations.
1414 void SetText( int value );
1415 /// Convenience method for setting text inside and element. See SetText() for important limitations.
1416 void SetText( unsigned value );
1417 /// Convenience method for setting text inside and element. See SetText() for important limitations.
1418 void SetText( bool value );
1419 /// Convenience method for setting text inside and element. See SetText() for important limitations.
1420 void SetText( double value );
1421 /// Convenience method for setting text inside and element. See SetText() for important limitations.
1422 void SetText( float value );
1423
1424 /**
1425 Convenience method to query the value of a child text node. This is probably best
1426 shown by example. Given you have a document is this form:
1427 @verbatim
1428 <point>
1429 <x>1</x>
1430 <y>1.4</y>
1431 </point>
1432 @endverbatim
1433
1434 The QueryIntText() and similar functions provide a safe and easier way to get to the
1435 "value" of x and y.
1436
1437 @verbatim
1438 int x = 0;
1439 float y = 0; // types of x and y are contrived for example
1440 const XMLElement* xElement = pointElement->FirstChildElement( "x" );
1441 const XMLElement* yElement = pointElement->FirstChildElement( "y" );
1442 xElement->QueryIntText( &x );
1443 yElement->QueryFloatText( &y );
1444 @endverbatim
1445
1446 @returns XML_SUCCESS (0) on success, XML_CAN_NOT_CONVERT_TEXT if the text cannot be converted
1447 to the requested type, and XML_NO_TEXT_NODE if there is no child text to query.
1448
1449 */
1450 XMLError QueryIntText( int* ival ) const;
1451 /// See QueryIntText()
1452 XMLError QueryUnsignedText( unsigned* uval ) const;
1453 /// See QueryIntText()
1454 XMLError QueryBoolText( bool* bval ) const;
1455 /// See QueryIntText()
1456 XMLError QueryDoubleText( double* dval ) const;
1457 /// See QueryIntText()
1458 XMLError QueryFloatText( float* fval ) const;
1459
1460 // internal:
1461 enum {
1462 OPEN, // <foo>
1463 CLOSED, // <foo/>
1464 CLOSING // </foo>
1465 };
1466 int ClosingType() const {
1467 return _closingType;
1468 }
1469 char* ParseDeep( char* p, StrPair* endTag );
1470 virtual XMLNode* ShallowClone( XMLDocument* document ) const;
1471 virtual bool ShallowEqual( const XMLNode* compare ) const;
1472
1473private:
1474 XMLElement( XMLDocument* doc );
1475 virtual ~XMLElement();
1476 XMLElement( const XMLElement& ); // not supported
1477 void operator=( const XMLElement& ); // not supported
1478
1479 XMLAttribute* FindAttribute( const char* name );
1480 XMLAttribute* FindOrCreateAttribute( const char* name );
1481 //void LinkAttribute( XMLAttribute* attrib );
1482 char* ParseAttributes( char* p );
1483
1484 enum { BUF_SIZE = 200 };
1485 int _closingType;
1486 // The attribute list is ordered; there is no 'lastAttribute'
1487 // because the list needs to be scanned for dupes before adding
1488 // a new attribute.
1489 XMLAttribute* _rootAttribute;
1490};
1491
1492
1493enum Whitespace {
1494 PRESERVE_WHITESPACE,
1495 COLLAPSE_WHITESPACE
1496};
1497
1498
1499/** A Document binds together all the functionality.
1500 It can be saved, loaded, and printed to the screen.
1501 All Nodes are connected and allocated to a Document.
1502 If the Document is deleted, all its Nodes are also deleted.
1503*/
1504class TINYXML2_LIB XMLDocument : public XMLNode
1505{
1506 friend class XMLElement;
1507public:
1508 /// constructor
1509 XMLDocument( bool processEntities = true, Whitespace = PRESERVE_WHITESPACE );
1510 ~XMLDocument();
1511
1512 virtual XMLDocument* ToDocument() {
1513 return this;
1514 }
1515 virtual const XMLDocument* ToDocument() const {
1516 return this;
1517 }
1518
1519 /**
1520 Parse an XML file from a character string.
1521 Returns XML_NO_ERROR (0) on success, or
1522 an errorID.
1523
1524 You may optionally pass in the 'nBytes', which is
1525 the number of bytes which will be parsed. If not
1526 specified, TinyXML-2 will assume 'xml' points to a
1527 null terminated string.
1528 */
1529 XMLError Parse( const char* xml, size_t nBytes=(size_t)(-1) );
1530
1531 /**
1532 Load an XML file from disk.
1533 Returns XML_NO_ERROR (0) on success, or
1534 an errorID.
1535 */
1536 XMLError LoadFile( const char* filename );
1537
1538 /**
1539 Load an XML file from disk. You are responsible
1540 for providing and closing the FILE*.
1541
1542 Returns XML_NO_ERROR (0) on success, or
1543 an errorID.
1544 */
1545 XMLError LoadFile( FILE* );
1546
1547 /**
1548 Save the XML file to disk.
1549 Returns XML_NO_ERROR (0) on success, or
1550 an errorID.
1551 */
1552 XMLError SaveFile( const char* filename, bool compact = false );
1553
1554 /**
1555 Save the XML file to disk. You are responsible
1556 for providing and closing the FILE*.
1557
1558 Returns XML_NO_ERROR (0) on success, or
1559 an errorID.
1560 */
1561 XMLError SaveFile( FILE* fp, bool compact = false );
1562
1563 bool ProcessEntities() const {
1564 return _processEntities;
1565 }
1566 Whitespace WhitespaceMode() const {
1567 return _whitespace;
1568 }
1569
1570 /**
1571 Returns true if this document has a leading Byte Order Mark of UTF8.
1572 */
1573 bool HasBOM() const {
1574 return _writeBOM;
1575 }
1576 /** Sets whether to write the BOM when writing the file.
1577 */
1578 void SetBOM( bool useBOM ) {
1579 _writeBOM = useBOM;
1580 }
1581
1582 /** Return the root element of DOM. Equivalent to FirstChildElement().
1583 To get the first node, use FirstChild().
1584 */
1585 XMLElement* RootElement() {
1586 return FirstChildElement();
1587 }
1588 const XMLElement* RootElement() const {
1589 return FirstChildElement();
1590 }
1591
1592 /** Print the Document. If the Printer is not provided, it will
1593 print to stdout. If you provide Printer, this can print to a file:
1594 @verbatim
1595 XMLPrinter printer( fp );
1596 doc.Print( &printer );
1597 @endverbatim
1598
1599 Or you can use a printer to print to memory:
1600 @verbatim
1601 XMLPrinter printer;
1602 doc.Print( &printer );
1603 // printer.CStr() has a const char* to the XML
1604 @endverbatim
1605 */
1606 void Print( XMLPrinter* streamer=0 ) const;
1607 virtual bool Accept( XMLVisitor* visitor ) const;
1608
1609 /**
1610 Create a new Element associated with
1611 this Document. The memory for the Element
1612 is managed by the Document.
1613 */
1614 XMLElement* NewElement( const char* name );
1615 /**
1616 Create a new Comment associated with
1617 this Document. The memory for the Comment
1618 is managed by the Document.
1619 */
1620 XMLComment* NewComment( const char* comment );
1621 /**
1622 Create a new Text associated with
1623 this Document. The memory for the Text
1624 is managed by the Document.
1625 */
1626 XMLText* NewText( const char* text );
1627 /**
1628 Create a new Declaration associated with
1629 this Document. The memory for the object
1630 is managed by the Document.
1631
1632 If the 'text' param is null, the standard
1633 declaration is used.:
1634 @verbatim
1635 <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
1636 @endverbatim
1637 */
1638 XMLDeclaration* NewDeclaration( const char* text=0 );
1639 /**
1640 Create a new Unknown associated with
1641 this Document. The memory for the object
1642 is managed by the Document.
1643 */
1644 XMLUnknown* NewUnknown( const char* text );
1645
1646 /**
1647 Delete a node associated with this document.
1648 It will be unlinked from the DOM.
1649 */
1650 void DeleteNode( XMLNode* node ) {
1651 node->_parent->DeleteChild( node );
1652 }
1653
1654 void SetError( XMLError error, const char* str1, const char* str2 );
1655
1656 /// Return true if there was an error parsing the document.
1657 bool Error() const {
1658 return _errorID != XML_NO_ERROR;
1659 }
1660 /// Return the errorID.
1661 XMLError ErrorID() const {
1662 return _errorID;
1663 }
1664 /// Return a possibly helpful diagnostic location or string.
1665 const char* GetErrorStr1() const {
1666 return _errorStr1;
1667 }
1668 /// Return a possibly helpful secondary diagnostic location or string.
1669 const char* GetErrorStr2() const {
1670 return _errorStr2;
1671 }
1672 /// If there is an error, print it to stdout.
1673 void PrintError() const;
1674
1675 /// Clear the document, resetting it to the initial state.
1676 void Clear();
1677
1678 // internal
1679 char* Identify( char* p, XMLNode** node );
1680
1681 virtual XMLNode* ShallowClone( XMLDocument* /*document*/ ) const {
1682 return 0;
1683 }
1684 virtual bool ShallowEqual( const XMLNode* /*compare*/ ) const {
1685 return false;
1686 }
1687
1688private:
1689 XMLDocument( const XMLDocument& ); // not supported
1690 void operator=( const XMLDocument& ); // not supported
1691
1692 bool _writeBOM;
1693 bool _processEntities;
1694 XMLError _errorID;
1695 Whitespace _whitespace;
1696 const char* _errorStr1;
1697 const char* _errorStr2;
1698 char* _charBuffer;
1699
1700 MemPoolT< sizeof(XMLElement) > _elementPool;
1701 MemPoolT< sizeof(XMLAttribute) > _attributePool;
1702 MemPoolT< sizeof(XMLText) > _textPool;
1703 MemPoolT< sizeof(XMLComment) > _commentPool;
1704};
1705
1706
1707/**
1708 A XMLHandle is a class that wraps a node pointer with null checks; this is
1709 an incredibly useful thing. Note that XMLHandle is not part of the TinyXML-2
1710 DOM structure. It is a separate utility class.
1711
1712 Take an example:
1713 @verbatim
1714 <Document>
1715 <Element attributeA = "valueA">
1716 <Child attributeB = "value1" />
1717 <Child attributeB = "value2" />
1718 </Element>
1719 </Document>
1720 @endverbatim
1721
1722 Assuming you want the value of "attributeB" in the 2nd "Child" element, it's very
1723 easy to write a *lot* of code that looks like:
1724
1725 @verbatim
1726 XMLElement* root = document.FirstChildElement( "Document" );
1727 if ( root )
1728 {
1729 XMLElement* element = root->FirstChildElement( "Element" );
1730 if ( element )
1731 {
1732 XMLElement* child = element->FirstChildElement( "Child" );
1733 if ( child )
1734 {
1735 XMLElement* child2 = child->NextSiblingElement( "Child" );
1736 if ( child2 )
1737 {
1738 // Finally do something useful.
1739 @endverbatim
1740
1741 And that doesn't even cover "else" cases. XMLHandle addresses the verbosity
1742 of such code. A XMLHandle checks for null pointers so it is perfectly safe
1743 and correct to use:
1744
1745 @verbatim
1746 XMLHandle docHandle( &document );
1747 XMLElement* child2 = docHandle.FirstChild( "Document" ).FirstChild( "Element" ).FirstChild().NextSibling().ToElement();
1748 if ( child2 )
1749 {
1750 // do something useful
1751 @endverbatim
1752
1753 Which is MUCH more concise and useful.
1754
1755 It is also safe to copy handles - internally they are nothing more than node pointers.
1756 @verbatim
1757 XMLHandle handleCopy = handle;
1758 @endverbatim
1759
1760 See also XMLConstHandle, which is the same as XMLHandle, but operates on const objects.
1761*/
1762class TINYXML2_LIB XMLHandle
1763{
1764public:
1765 /// Create a handle from any node (at any depth of the tree.) This can be a null pointer.
1766 XMLHandle( XMLNode* node ) {
1767 _node = node;
1768 }
1769 /// Create a handle from a node.
1770 XMLHandle( XMLNode& node ) {
1771 _node = &node;
1772 }
1773 /// Copy constructor
1774 XMLHandle( const XMLHandle& ref ) {
1775 _node = ref._node;
1776 }
1777 /// Assignment
1778 XMLHandle& operator=( const XMLHandle& ref ) {
1779 _node = ref._node;
1780 return *this;
1781 }
1782
1783 /// Get the first child of this handle.
1784 XMLHandle FirstChild() {
1785 return XMLHandle( _node ? _node->FirstChild() : 0 );
1786 }
1787 /// Get the first child element of this handle.
1788 XMLHandle FirstChildElement( const char* value=0 ) {
1789 return XMLHandle( _node ? _node->FirstChildElement( value ) : 0 );
1790 }
1791 /// Get the last child of this handle.
1792 XMLHandle LastChild() {
1793 return XMLHandle( _node ? _node->LastChild() : 0 );
1794 }
1795 /// Get the last child element of this handle.
1796 XMLHandle LastChildElement( const char* _value=0 ) {
1797 return XMLHandle( _node ? _node->LastChildElement( _value ) : 0 );
1798 }
1799 /// Get the previous sibling of this handle.
1800 XMLHandle PreviousSibling() {
1801 return XMLHandle( _node ? _node->PreviousSibling() : 0 );
1802 }
1803 /// Get the previous sibling element of this handle.
1804 XMLHandle PreviousSiblingElement( const char* _value=0 ) {
1805 return XMLHandle( _node ? _node->PreviousSiblingElement( _value ) : 0 );
1806 }
1807 /// Get the next sibling of this handle.
1808 XMLHandle NextSibling() {
1809 return XMLHandle( _node ? _node->NextSibling() : 0 );
1810 }
1811 /// Get the next sibling element of this handle.
1812 XMLHandle NextSiblingElement( const char* _value=0 ) {
1813 return XMLHandle( _node ? _node->NextSiblingElement( _value ) : 0 );
1814 }
1815
1816 /// Safe cast to XMLNode. This can return null.
1817 XMLNode* ToNode() {
1818 return _node;
1819 }
1820 /// Safe cast to XMLElement. This can return null.
1821 XMLElement* ToElement() {
1822 return ( ( _node == 0 ) ? 0 : _node->ToElement() );
1823 }
1824 /// Safe cast to XMLText. This can return null.
1825 XMLText* ToText() {
1826 return ( ( _node == 0 ) ? 0 : _node->ToText() );
1827 }
1828 /// Safe cast to XMLUnknown. This can return null.
1829 XMLUnknown* ToUnknown() {
1830 return ( ( _node == 0 ) ? 0 : _node->ToUnknown() );
1831 }
1832 /// Safe cast to XMLDeclaration. This can return null.
1833 XMLDeclaration* ToDeclaration() {
1834 return ( ( _node == 0 ) ? 0 : _node->ToDeclaration() );
1835 }
1836
1837private:
1838 XMLNode* _node;
1839};
1840
1841
1842/**
1843 A variant of the XMLHandle class for working with const XMLNodes and Documents. It is the
1844 same in all regards, except for the 'const' qualifiers. See XMLHandle for API.
1845*/
1846class TINYXML2_LIB XMLConstHandle
1847{
1848public:
1849 XMLConstHandle( const XMLNode* node ) {
1850 _node = node;
1851 }
1852 XMLConstHandle( const XMLNode& node ) {
1853 _node = &node;
1854 }
1855 XMLConstHandle( const XMLConstHandle& ref ) {
1856 _node = ref._node;
1857 }
1858
1859 XMLConstHandle& operator=( const XMLConstHandle& ref ) {
1860 _node = ref._node;
1861 return *this;
1862 }
1863
1864 const XMLConstHandle FirstChild() const {
1865 return XMLConstHandle( _node ? _node->FirstChild() : 0 );
1866 }
1867 const XMLConstHandle FirstChildElement( const char* value=0 ) const {
1868 return XMLConstHandle( _node ? _node->FirstChildElement( value ) : 0 );
1869 }
1870 const XMLConstHandle LastChild() const {
1871 return XMLConstHandle( _node ? _node->LastChild() : 0 );
1872 }
1873 const XMLConstHandle LastChildElement( const char* _value=0 ) const {
1874 return XMLConstHandle( _node ? _node->LastChildElement( _value ) : 0 );
1875 }
1876 const XMLConstHandle PreviousSibling() const {
1877 return XMLConstHandle( _node ? _node->PreviousSibling() : 0 );
1878 }
1879 const XMLConstHandle PreviousSiblingElement( const char* _value=0 ) const {
1880 return XMLConstHandle( _node ? _node->PreviousSiblingElement( _value ) : 0 );
1881 }
1882 const XMLConstHandle NextSibling() const {
1883 return XMLConstHandle( _node ? _node->NextSibling() : 0 );
1884 }
1885 const XMLConstHandle NextSiblingElement( const char* _value=0 ) const {
1886 return XMLConstHandle( _node ? _node->NextSiblingElement( _value ) : 0 );
1887 }
1888
1889
1890 const XMLNode* ToNode() const {
1891 return _node;
1892 }
1893 const XMLElement* ToElement() const {
1894 return ( ( _node == 0 ) ? 0 : _node->ToElement() );
1895 }
1896 const XMLText* ToText() const {
1897 return ( ( _node == 0 ) ? 0 : _node->ToText() );
1898 }
1899 const XMLUnknown* ToUnknown() const {
1900 return ( ( _node == 0 ) ? 0 : _node->ToUnknown() );
1901 }
1902 const XMLDeclaration* ToDeclaration() const {
1903 return ( ( _node == 0 ) ? 0 : _node->ToDeclaration() );
1904 }
1905
1906private:
1907 const XMLNode* _node;
1908};
1909
1910
1911/**
1912 Printing functionality. The XMLPrinter gives you more
1913 options than the XMLDocument::Print() method.
1914
1915 It can:
1916 -# Print to memory.
1917 -# Print to a file you provide.
1918 -# Print XML without a XMLDocument.
1919
1920 Print to Memory
1921
1922 @verbatim
1923 XMLPrinter printer;
1924 doc.Print( &printer );
1925 SomeFunction( printer.CStr() );
1926 @endverbatim
1927
1928 Print to a File
1929
1930 You provide the file pointer.
1931 @verbatim
1932 XMLPrinter printer( fp );
1933 doc.Print( &printer );
1934 @endverbatim
1935
1936 Print without a XMLDocument
1937
1938 When loading, an XML parser is very useful. However, sometimes
1939 when saving, it just gets in the way. The code is often set up
1940 for streaming, and constructing the DOM is just overhead.
1941
1942 The Printer supports the streaming case. The following code
1943 prints out a trivially simple XML file without ever creating
1944 an XML document.
1945
1946 @verbatim
1947 XMLPrinter printer( fp );
1948 printer.OpenElement( "foo" );
1949 printer.PushAttribute( "foo", "bar" );
1950 printer.CloseElement();
1951 @endverbatim
1952*/
1953class TINYXML2_LIB XMLPrinter : public XMLVisitor
1954{
1955public:
1956 /** Construct the printer. If the FILE* is specified,
1957 this will print to the FILE. Else it will print
1958 to memory, and the result is available in CStr().
1959 If 'compact' is set to true, then output is created
1960 with only required whitespace and newlines.
1961 */
1962 XMLPrinter( FILE* file=0, bool compact = false, int depth = 0 );
1963 virtual ~XMLPrinter() {}
1964
1965 /** If streaming, write the BOM and declaration. */
1966 void PushHeader( bool writeBOM, bool writeDeclaration );
1967 /** If streaming, start writing an element.
1968 The element must be closed with CloseElement()
1969 */
1970 void OpenElement( const char* name, bool compactMode=false );
1971 /// If streaming, add an attribute to an open element.
1972 void PushAttribute( const char* name, const char* value );
1973 void PushAttribute( const char* name, int value );
1974 void PushAttribute( const char* name, unsigned value );
1975 void PushAttribute( const char* name, bool value );
1976 void PushAttribute( const char* name, double value );
1977 /// If streaming, close the Element.
1978 virtual void CloseElement( bool compactMode=false );
1979
1980 /// Add a text node.
1981 void PushText( const char* text, bool cdata=false );
1982 /// Add a text node from an integer.
1983 void PushText( int value );
1984 /// Add a text node from an unsigned.
1985 void PushText( unsigned value );
1986 /// Add a text node from a bool.
1987 void PushText( bool value );
1988 /// Add a text node from a float.
1989 void PushText( float value );
1990 /// Add a text node from a double.
1991 void PushText( double value );
1992
1993 /// Add a comment
1994 void PushComment( const char* comment );
1995
1996 void PushDeclaration( const char* value );
1997 void PushUnknown( const char* value );
1998
1999 virtual bool VisitEnter( const XMLDocument& /*doc*/ );
2000 virtual bool VisitExit( const XMLDocument& /*doc*/ ) {
2001 return true;
2002 }
2003
2004 virtual bool VisitEnter( const XMLElement& element, const XMLAttribute* attribute );
2005 virtual bool VisitExit( const XMLElement& element );
2006
2007 virtual bool Visit( const XMLText& text );
2008 virtual bool Visit( const XMLComment& comment );
2009 virtual bool Visit( const XMLDeclaration& declaration );
2010 virtual bool Visit( const XMLUnknown& unknown );
2011
2012 /**
2013 If in print to memory mode, return a pointer to
2014 the XML file in memory.
2015 */
2016 const char* CStr() const {
2017 return _buffer.Mem();
2018 }
2019 /**
2020 If in print to memory mode, return the size
2021 of the XML file in memory. (Note the size returned
2022 includes the terminating null.)
2023 */
2024 int CStrSize() const {
2025 return _buffer.Size();
2026 }
2027 /**
2028 If in print to memory mode, reset the buffer to the
2029 beginning.
2030 */
2031 void ClearBuffer() {
2032 _buffer.Clear();
2033 _buffer.Push(0);
2034 }
2035
2036protected:
2037 virtual bool CompactMode( const XMLElement& ) { return _compactMode; }
2038
2039 /** Prints out the space before an element. You may override to change
2040 the space and tabs used. A PrintSpace() override should call Print().
2041 */
2042 virtual void PrintSpace( int depth );
2043 void Print( const char* format, ... );
2044
2045 void SealElement();
2046 bool _elementJustOpened;
2047 DynArray< const char*, 10 > _stack;
2048
2049private:
2050 void PrintString( const char*, bool restrictedEntitySet ); // prints out, after detecting entities.
2051
2052 bool _firstElement;
2053 FILE* _fp;
2054 int _depth;
2055 int _textDepth;
2056 bool _processEntities;
2057 bool _compactMode;
2058
2059 enum {
2060 ENTITY_RANGE = 64,
2061 BUF_SIZE = 200
2062 };
2063 bool _entityFlag[ENTITY_RANGE];
2064 bool _restrictedEntityFlag[ENTITY_RANGE];
2065
2066 DynArray< char, 20 > _buffer;
2067};
2068
2069
2070} // tinyxml2
